revised_title: Evidence of Gradual Land Rising in Sweden
tldr: Charles Lyell investigates the rising of the land in certain parts of Sweden and provides evidence of a gradual elevation of the land. He examines various locations, including Calmar, Stockholm, and Upsala, and concludes that the elevation of the land has occurred over time. The phenomenon has been observed in the presence of shells, plants, and artificial marks in rocks, which indicate a change in the relative level of the sea and land.
